39170306.review:
The Sad Story Of Emmeline Burns é triste como menciona no nome, e sim, lenço em mãos (para os olhos ok).
O enredo envolve espiritualidade, vidas passadas, amor e amizade, e aqui foi um bom - ótimo, na verdade - conjunto formado.
Coloca-se a arte bem feita e a trilha bem estruturada, tanto de sons como de música, e temos um conto visual, literalmente, tão bom quanto alguns de livros.

É temporal, época vitoriana (perfeitamente adequada, inclusive de diálogo) e delicado aos olhos. Inclusive o "terror" ou "sobrenatural" aqui é claro e ao mesmo tempo sutil, dando aquela resultado de romance, regado com carinho e um drama que caminha em uma tênue linha com o romance.

Como Doki, ou qualquer outro Visual Novel, a jogabilidade desse aqui não é diferente: não há opções, além de uma história reta, que apenas escolhendo o "auto" no menu, e você fica apenas a assistir o que o jogo propõe, tanto que conquistas, vêm ao que se segue, sem nos mexermos literalmente para nada.

É uma ótima história para interessados no gênero, emocionante e inclusive, dá algumas lições de moral, em forma bem sutil, além daquela sensação de esperança, de ver que certos sentimentos se compartilham inclusive nos games.

38839250.review:
Wow... I knew this game is rather highly regarded, but I have to say it surpassed my expectations. It's definitely not for everyone, not only because of the yuri theme, but also because of how sentimental and at times sad it is. It's also a kinetic novel and a fairly short one at that, so it's more or less an illustrated book that will take you around 2 hours to read through, with no interactivity whatsoever. For me though, it was deeply touching and satisfying experience - it got me crying, but left me hopeful and moved rather than depressed and it's really all I could ever ask from a short story like this.

[i]The Sad Story...[/i] was created for the Yuri Game Jam, so f/f romance is its main theme, but it touches on much more universal topics and I think it should be satisfying even if you're not a fan of "girls' love" stories. It's well-paced, written in very good prose and the story content is complimented by rather beautiful visual assets and music. It goes above and beyond what you could normally expect from a game jam entry. I don't want to write much more so I can avoid spoilers - just play it, with the game being free, there's really no reasons not to.

35808591.review:
[h1][b]Exclusivo de PC[/b][/h1]
[b]Ano:[/b] 2015
[b]Motor:[/b] Ren'Py
[b]Classificação PEGI:[/b] Nenhuma
[b]Proezas?[/b] Sim
[b]Cartas?[/b] Não
[b]Modo Online?[/b] Não
[b]Mundo:[/b] [É uma novela gráfica]

[b]História:[/b] Toma Andrews, uma adolescente de apenas 14 anos, resolve faltar um dia à escola para passar pelo cemitério (ela gosta de ir aos cemitérios por serem calmos, ela é uma rapariga reservada). Nesse dia ela encontra-se com "Emily" (Emmeline Burns), uma rapariga de também 14 anos do século XIX, que conta a sua história e de como morreu. Conta sobre a sua namorada da adolescência, Cornelia, com quem não teve a oportunidade de viver uma longa vida lado a lado. A história foca-se principalmente no romance entre Emmeline e Cornelia, 

[b]Gráficos:[/b] Como se trata de uma novela gráfica, baseia-se em desenhos 2D. São ilustrações bem feitas, com qualidade, tanto as personagens como os cenários.

[b]Jogabilidade:[/b] Esta novela gráfica não contém escolhas, apenas teremos de ler e ir avançando. As proezas desbloqueiam-se à medida que avançamos na história. Este jogo ainda inclui um capítulo extra que é desbloqueado depois de terminarmos a história.

[b]Banda Sonora:[/b] É boa e não se torna enjoativa. Até que gostei da música dos créditos também, "Her Story" de Hungry Lucy (2003).

[b]Dificuldade:[/b] Bem, já que é só para ler, não há nenhuma dificuldade, pelo menos para quem entende inglês.

[b]Durabilidade:[/b] Infelizmente é curto, demora menos de três horas para completar.

[b]Dobragem:[/b] Este jogo não possui dobragem.

[b]Personagens:[/b] Emmeline, Cornelia, Toma e Hattie, as quatro adolescentes. Aparece o pai de Emmeline apenas numa cena [spoiler](uma cena bem triste, aviso já)[/spoiler]. Várias outras personagens são apenas mencionadas nos diálogos.

[b]Bugs:[/b] Não presenciei nenhum bug.

[b]Observações:[/b] Adorei esta novela gráfica, a história em si tocou-me, coisa que não é comum acontecer com este tipo de jogo (algumas novelas gráficas fazem-me quase adormecer). Este jogo é gratuito e vê-se que está bem feito, com qualidade nas ilustrações, sem erros ortográficos (que eu tenha reparado) e boa banda sonora.

34442735.review:
From developer ebi-hime and publisher Sekai Project comes The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns, the anime visual novel. Released in 2016, this is a yuri casual adventure game, that's been rated very positive since it's release to Steam. Seeing it, I decided to give it a go and see what it was like.

Toma Andrews, aged 14, has always felt like an outsider. She enjoys spending time in graveyards, and feels more comfortable among the dead than the living. 
That is, until Toma meets a strange girl in her local graveyard who might be a real ghost. 
The girl asks Toma if she will stay for a while and listen to a story. A story about a girl called Emmeline Burns, who died a tragic death back in 1851. 
Toma is compelled to listen, but at the same time, she feels uneasy. After all, what can she do? How could she ever hope to help somebody who has already died?

After reading this summary on Steam, I was really intrigued after downloading it, even more so than I already was, and had to jump in.

I admit, I was a little bit disappointed. There wasn't much to this game other than a story. The story itself got a little boring at times, and it was a struggle to get through. However, the artwork was absolutely beautiful. I was shaken by just how much obvious work had gone into character and background designs. The artists did so much work on this short game and it has definitely paid off. I was expecting some choices in the game, but came across none, which was part of my disappointment, but the rest of the game definitely made up for it.

The achievements are all story related and are extremely easy to get, so it's definitely a good one for achievement hunters to pick up an extra 83 TSA points. It's a quick game, 0-1 hours for completion, and I think it's definitely an hour well spent.

I love this so much, and I cannot wait to see what else ebi-hime develop. I recommend this to anyone who enjoy anime and/or visual novels, and people with an interest in artwork in games.

This was stunning. I would play it again.

4 out of 5 stars

Toma is a girl who feels as if she has the wrong identity; she had her identity taken away even before she was born. She wonders how life would've been if she had a different name. Her father ran away when she was a little child; she never knew her dad.

Emmeline Burns is a girl who loved her dad fondly, even though he was barely at home due to work. Throughout her years, everything she ever loved and had were snatched away from her; she lost everything.

This story tells the tale of young Emmeline and her very sad tale. [spoiler] Her lover and her father were taken away from her, what is a fourteen year old girl to do?	[/spoiler]

This was a beautiful game that has obviously had a lot of love and thought put into it, and while I usually only play VNs once or twice, this is one I could see myself coming back to every now and again.

It has such a great atmosphere, and has surprisingly feel good moments for such a sad story which blends together to make a great combination that makes the sad moments even more jarring.

Also, maybe I'm biased becase I love this sort of thing, but it has heavy emphasis on character analysis and development, and while an hour seems like a short amount of time to explore a person they manage to make you extremely familiar with the characters and nothing feels rushed at all. There's no "why didn't this character do this or that", it's just well established to the point you instantly understand.

One last thing for anyone else worried about how lesbians in the media usually end up: [spoiler]It has a happy ending, don't worry ^^ [/spoiler]
Cannot reccomend this enough (^v^)

[h1]The game.[/h1]
Just other visual novel story with nothing special. This VN is a short story of a lesbian romance between two girls. A teenager called Toma Andrews, the main character, have a graveyard obsession and a shaky sense of her own identity (in every way), found a girl in a cemetery in oddly period clothes, who tells her the story of a young lady named Emmeline Burns, who died back in 1851. The story itself is fairly straightforward and in general is sad, as title says.

The game is a poorly done storyline about tragedy and love, it hasn't gameplay, no choices to be had. The writing, for example, is replete with poorly constructed sentences and tone problems. And at times, the handful of characters we see look less like beautiful young maidens than they do Victorian Era dolls. All achievements unlocked in 2 minutes.

[quote][h1]Positive points. (+)[/h1][list]
[*]Easy and fast to get all achievements.
[*]The story is quite short and tells the essential.
[/list][/quote]

[quote][h1]Negative points. (+)[/h1][list]
[*]Poorly and predictable storyline.
[*]Grammar and writing are sloppy.
[*]No gameplay, no choices. You can't change the course of history.
[/list][/quote]

30500755.review:
I just finished this and I will say, and I never leave reviews for games because I can never put to words how awesome they can be, this VN left me with so much feeling after finishing it. I cried and laughed and I love when something can do that to me. Usually when a story of any kind leaves me in tears I never want to pick it up again, never wanting to go through those feelings but with this story I honestly want to read it all over again!

I read many of the reviews before actually getting it myself. I wanted to see what everyone else thought. But in the end after reading so many of them that recommended it, I just had to get it myself to see what I would think. I am so glad I did.

For some the story will seem very short, and it is. But honestly do we want to spend all day reading? I would have loved it if this had been longer but the length that it is, is perfect. For some the story will not be paced particularly well. In fact I actually believe otherwise. It's paced very well for the story itself. You don't want to go through every inch of someone's past to get to the present. You're brought into the story, at the parts that are relevant to the story itself. You're brought in to discover Emmeline and Toma and everyone else involved. To learn what you SHOULD about them. You get pieces that fit well together to make the story work and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

But in all honesty you should get this for yourself. It's free! It isn't for everyone so don't just base your decision on what someone else says. If you're interested in the least, pick it up.

I do have one thing that I didn't like about it. The sound effects. The soundtrack is beautiful and then you have sound effects over it that just ruin it. But that aside, my words still stand. Try it out for yourself and see what you think about it.

29403750.review:
Well, it's got better heart than Voices from the Sea. That game was a piece of sh**.

The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is about an Angsty Story of Toma, a girl who doesn't like her name and is troubled with thoughts of death and has remained shy her whole life. That is, until, she meets a strange girl named Emily in a graveyard who tells her the story of the deceased Emmeline Burns... and then the sad story kicks in!

The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is a sad story about a girl named Emmeline Burns who is a lesbian in the 1800's (I think) and then she dies. So sad.

I won't spoil anything major, but both stories aren't that particularly well-written or presented. It's all about finding confidence in yourself and coming of age and blah-dee-blah-dee-blah, but the progressive "choose who you want to love, no matter if they're your gender or not" edge did make me a little more keen to support something like this.... If there were some actual g****** conflict in it.

See, the idea of the story is interesting. A lesbian couple in the 1800's! How do they get away with it? Do their parents find out? Does the whole town find out and punish them? No. They just go off and make out. There's nothing at stake with anything that happens in the story. Even the cause of Emmeline's death seems very sudden and forced (Seriously, those motivations are very weak. No spoilers. Just saying.), and Toma's frame narrative is equally as uninteresting. She doesn't like her name. She goes to a grave. She hears a ghost tell a story. And then she feels better about herself. She's not a very interesting character and, again, nothing is at stake for her because there is no conflict.

There is a little something towards the end (after the credits of all times) when things look up for Toma but it's too short and too late for me to care anymore. It's after the f***ing credits! Why should I care?

Presentation is also pretty low, but that's what I've come to expect from these interactive novels. Still images poorly animate and low-quality sound effects play over some stock music the developer found for free. But they have the protagonist as one of the still images... and they have both characters (including the protagonist) looking towards YOU the player, which makes no sense. I'm supposed to be Toma, right? She's my insert into this story, isn't she? So why is she looking at me in these conversations? It's a very unusual choice and I don't think it helps the story in any way, shape, or form.

I think Emmeline Burns has got some heart deep down inside. There are certainly qualities in it that I like... but it's bogged down by some lousy writing and some low presentation quality. That and the story is pretty linear. There's no replay value because the game takes about an hour to beat and you make no choices throughout the whole story. So why should I go back and play again? Because I loved the "deep" and "compelling" characters? Thanks but no thanks. I'm giving The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns a 4/10. It's got some good ideas, but.... there's a lot of sh** piled on top of those few good ideas.

29114765.review:
[h1] << The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns / Юри и точка! >> [/h1]

[h1] Сюжет (Warning! Возможны спойлеры): [/h1]

Новелла начинается с утверждения о краже личности через кражу имени и о том, как же плохо жить девочке с полу-мужским именем. Главная героиня (Тома), обладая экстрасенсорной способностью "искать мертвецов" решает привычно прогуляться по кладбищу в поисках тишины и покоя но, не тут-то было! Она встречает на кладбище девочку, одетую в викторианском стиле и по сути не находя в этом ничего странного вступает с ней в беседу. Та девочка (Эммелин), в свою очередь, решает рассказать свою печальную историю жизни. История пестрит однополой любовью и феминистическими нотами, что в скором времени начало меня раздражать. Я конечно толерантен, но даже для меня "это" не столько романтично, сколько глупо (однополая любовь 2-ух 15-летних девочек в викторианскую эпоху? Увольте!). Услышав эту историю, Тома решает повторить её, но уже на себе и своей единственной подруге (Хетти или как там её...). Ну и думаю нетрудно догадаться, что происходит далее по закону жанра. 

[h1] Мнение о сюжете: [/h1]

Что же до моего мнения... Мне всё это не очень понравилось, т.к. вся история практически "притянута за уши" и не вызывает должных мыслей о неравноправии между женщинами и мужчинами в 19-ом веке. Единственное, что действительно порадовало, так это частые упоминания и отсылки к литературным произведениям в диалогах персонажей, более этого, в сюжете мне ничего особо и не понравилось.

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

Рисовка была в своеобразном стиле разработчика новеллы (если вы конечно читали другие его новеллы, такие как Strawberry Vinegar или Asphyxia) и выполнена довольно красочно (что можно заметить по скриншотам), по сему я остался ею полностью доволен. 

Музыкальное сопровождение было довольно заурядным и незапоминающемся, в отличии от звукового. Нет, не потому что оно было выполнено приятно, а совсем наоборот. Звуки были неестественными и некачественными (с таким же успехом от них и вовсе можно было отказаться).

Новелла является кинетической и на сюжет никак нельзя будет повлиять (хотя в настройках почему-то присутствует пункт: "останавливать на паузу или продолжать чтение после выбора"). По длительности же, новелла довольно маленькая (примерно полтора часа чтения), но это не так уж и плохо для бесплатной новеллы. Единственное, что огорчает, так это то, что придётся скачивать русификатор, но думаю для многих это не составит проблемы.

[h1] Итог: [/h1]

Подводя итог, я хоть и с натяжкой, но могу сказать, что новелла всё же достойна внимания и потраченного на неё времени (особенно учитывая нынешние интересы). За сим, положительный отзыв и рекомендация к прочтению.

29067971.review:
Please keep in mind that I very, very rarely write reviews for games- even the ones I thoroughly enjoy- but this game inspired something in me. This game, simply put, is absolutely beautiful. I was weary at first, seeing as I am not particularly a fan of visual novels. But this one was different. And, since it was free, I decided to give it a chance. It is not a 'choose your own path' kind of visual novel. Instead, this visual novel is simply an experience. It requires no effort to play other than simple clicking to progress dialogue. The story and beautiful illustrations, coupled with a great soundtrack (My favorite song is 'Her Song') make this an experience that everyone should enjoy. The cherry on top of the cake though, for me, was that the storyline centers around a story between two young (female) friends who fall in love with each other. As someone who is a member of the LGBT community, I was profoundly touched by this. In my opinion, there need to be more games like this. 
10/10, would play and love it (and probs cry) again.

26585339.review:
Get 100% Achievement in less then 5mins.

1. Open up a new game

2. Wait until the buttons appear at the bottom of the screen

3. Click "Prefs" which is the Key.

4. Make Skip: ON, 
After choices: Keep skipping 
Transitions: All on. 

5. Click "Return"

6. Click "F.Skip" and click yes. (May cause the game to freeze, but once it's loaded it should be fine) 

7. You get 7/8 achevements. Last one go to the main menu. Click on Extra Scene "Powder Pad Thing" (Top right)

8. "F.Skip" 8/8 Congrats.

26479249.review:
Хотела написать пару строк об этой игре сразу после прохождения, но вечно на что-то отвлекалась. Но все же она стоит того, чтобы немного высказаться, так что делаю это сейчас.
Это короткая визуальная новелла, в которой вообще нет выборов, так что это не игра, но история. И история, как рассказывает нам название, действительно печальная. Она повествует о девушке, о ее любви к другой девушке и о том, как ее жизнь трагически оборвалась в один момент. История написано хорошо и читать ее приятно, но боюсь, кому-то диалоги могут показаться слишком "приторными", если вы не нежный душой человек, то возможно, вам все же не стоит читать эту новеллу. На небольшую продолжительность есть пять милых иллюстраций, и всему этому сопутствует ненавзячивое музыкальное сопровождение, которое, впрочем не заслуживает особо внимания, а вот визуальный стиль действительно хорошенький.
Новелла, несмотря на грусть, очень светлая, и заставила меня улыбнуться в конце. После прохождения хочется сказать: берегите своих любимых и не бойтесь говорить им о своих чувствах, потому что второго шанса может и не быть.

This reminds me of To The Moon.  After experiencing it, I feel like the former would have benefited greatly had its story been told in a visual novel format as well.  I appreciate that with this format there are no annoying or tedious mechanics that distract from the plot.  Playing this is essentially reading a short story with accompanying music, sound effects, and illustrations which come alive through animation.

I cannot compare this to other visual novels as I haven't read any others.  I thought the writing was great and was convincing of its setting in 18th century England.  The writing is a step above anything you could get from other mediums of video games, and it very well should be, considering what this game really is.

I finished this in two hours but it could definitely be read faster than that.

25052254.review:
“腼腆的玫瑰花刺儿多得很，  温驯的羊儿常拿角吓人。百合花却一味在爱情里陶醉， 没有刺也没有角损坏她的美。”——威廉·布莱克

我为什么要背诗呢，因为我也不知道该说什么好....作为Galgame画面难得不是日漫风格，语言轻快风趣，故事嘛......就有点简单粗暴了......


所以——

┌( ಠ_ಠ)┘做个2分钟全成就攻略吧：

第一步：打开游戏
第二步：戳右下角的钥匙，把 Skip调成on，After choice调成keep skipping，播放速度和前进速度拉到最大
第三步：戳第一层柜子，开始游戏，戳最底下的F.skip，然后yes，扑拉扑拉你的成就只剩下一个没解了
第四步：回主菜单戳柜子顶上的那一坨，戳最底下的F.skip，然后yes，恭喜你全成就了

顺便提醒，游戏讨论区第二置顶贴内有人贴心的制作了汉化，实测可用，覆盖安装后进入游戏如果仍未显示中文，戳底部的钥匙（话说这游戏的菜单UI设计的是真够含蓄）打开“设置”修改语言选项即可。

24861369.review:
"The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns" ist eine kleine, kostenlose englische Visual-Novel.

Unsere Protagonistin ist Toma Andrews, ein vierzehnjähriges Mädchen, beschäftigt mit typischen Adoleszenz-Problemen, Schüchternheit, der eigenen Persönlichkeitsbildung und Selbstdefinition, den ersten Homo-Erotischen Gedankenspielen und Erlebnissen. Verschränkt wird diese an sich noch unspektakuläre Geschichte der Jetztzeit mit einer historischen, im 18.Jahrhundert beheimateten Parallelhandlung, die ihre Vorfahren betrifft.

Da es sich wirklich um eine Visual Novel handelt, kann man von Gameplay nicht sprechen. Wir lesen uns durch die Geschichte und hin und wieder ändern sich die Hintergründe. Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten gibt es nicht. Auch wenn die Screens recht lange stehen, der grundlegende Rhythmus und die Wechsel sind sowohl grafisch als auch musikalisch und akustisch gut auf die Geschichte abgestimmt.

Der Art-Style ist pastellartig, wirkt fast ständig überbelichtet und dadurch aber sehr weich, feminin und unschuldig. Die Klavierstücke passen sich dieser Richtung gekonnt an.

Auch wenn die Geschichte meist vorhersehbar und einfach gestrickt ist und auch wenn alles zu auserzählt und ausformuliert ist, im Kern ist die Story intelligent geschrieben, gut gebaut und bei allen Klischees, die ein solches Genre mit sich bringt, doch sehr menschlich und emotional nachvollziehbar.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosphäre
8/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
8/10 Spielmechanik
-/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Gut erzählte adoleszierende Visual-Novel für lau.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

The writing in the game is well done, and while the story is not the most unique thing in the world it still kept me interested (I don't often play VN's and skip video game stories because they are usually too boring and contrived). It is short but well paced, though the very start is a bit slow (as expected because it is introducing a character). The characters felt realistic and the protagonist feels easily relatable (regardless of your gender).

The artwork is charming and definently has its own style that I really enjoyed. The UI and font choices aren't the best but they do not impede on the games overall artwork and story.

The soundtrack was calming and complimented the dialogue, and I enjoyed the final song that played during the credits (the vocals were nice). The sound effects are also well timed and do not feel out of place.

I would recommend this even if you don't usually play Visual Novels but enjoy reading as a seperate hobby.

24289458.review:
I avoided this game for a while because Western period dramas bore me to tears; I have a very hard time relating to them. That being said, I'm SO glad that I decided to finally bite the bullet and play/read this.

The story alternates between the contemporary age and the Victorian one, allowing the player/reader to immerse themselves in the perspective of teenagers occupying both time periods. The characters are very fleshed out for such a short script and their dialogue is refreshingly consistent in terms of their personalities & eras.

As a very jaded individual, I don't have the patience for coming-of-age stories anymore either. In this case, I related so deeply to the main character's narration that it was impossible to remain neutral on the journey. Ultimately, this is a story about finding the courage to become who you are. Playing/reading this reminded me that the struggle for identity never ends; nor should it.

Thank you for sharing this wonderful experience with us! It's one of those stories a person can fortify themselves with, and that's exactly what I've done <3

23470564.review:
[b]Ужасно стариком быть без седин;
Он равных не находит; за толпою
Идет, хоть с ней не делится душою;
Он меж людьми ни раб, ни властелин,
И все, что чувствует, он чувствует один![/b]
(С) М. Ю. Лермонтов

Очень часто дети становятся пленниками прошлого их родителей. Скажем у родителей жизнь на задалась еще в детстве, а потому либо они решают беречь свое чадо как зарницу ока, либо же напротив пьют горькую и из алкогольного тумана их сможет вырвать лишь известие о сухом законе, да и то не факт. И в том и в другом случае ребенок страдает. В первой ситуации опека является чрезмерной и ребенок не может сделать самостоятельные шаги в этот мир без указки со стороны старших, во втором случае ему попросту будет не у кого спросить совета и он озлобится на весь мир, предпочитая бить первым, не важно кого, даже тех кто желает ему добра. Ну или родители очень часто прибегают к сравнениям: «Вот Вася из соседнего подъезда работал в твоем возрасте». И не важно, что этот самый Вася сидит сейчас на скамье подсудимых по обвинению в вооруженном нападение, важен сам прецедент. Не подумайте, я не говорю, что родители плохие. Они и впрямь желают своим детям добра… большинство из них. Но вместо того чтобы быть примером на который можно равняться, они пытаются сделать из своего чада того человека, каким они сами хотели быть, но так и не стали. Вот и история, о которой пойдет речь в сегодняшней игре, непосредственно завязана на девочке, у которой украли личность. Во всяком случае именно эту мысль вбила ей мама, а ведь мама всегда права, верно?

Главной героиней истории выступает девочка, которую изначально должны были звать Амелией, но сестра матери девочки назвала так свою дочь, отчего главной героини досталось имя Тома. Девочка убедила себя, что это не ее имя, а вместе с тем это и не ее личность и потому она стала серой мышкой, невидимкой, на которую никто не обращает внимания. И любимым занятием девушки стало ходить по кладбищу и искать давно почивших родственников задаваясь вопросами – какую жизнь они прожили, были ли они счастливы или были вынуждены притворятся тем, кем не являются? Любовь к кладбищам также досталась девочке от матери, но не о том речь. Куда важнее то, что Тома сбежав с уроков и бесцельно бродя по кладбищу задалась вопросом: «А что бы было если я умерла? Вот прямо сейчас. Вспомнил ли кто-нибудь обо мне? И каково это оказаться на той стороне?» Небо прорезал всполох молнии и округу огласил гром, после которого Тома услышала шаги, которые стали раздаваться все ближе…

Такая вот завязка истории. Кому-то она может показаться слегка тривиальной, а для кого-то станет откровением, но опять же суть не в этом. Куда важнее то, что игра легко и ненавязчиво говорит нам – в любой ситуации нужно быть собой. Не важно, что думают о тебе окружающие, одобряя или наоборот не одобряя твои увлечения или жизненны ценности. Это не важно по той простой причине, что это твоя жизнь. Ее никто за тебя не проживает, а потому надо прожить ее так, чтобы потом не сожалеть об упущенных возможностях и словах, которые не были сказаны близким тебе людям. Да, жизнь штука сложная и неудачам в ней всегда найдется место, но если не будешь пытаться, то и нечего будет вспомнить. 

Красивое послание, облаченное в не менее красивую упаковку, вопрос лишь в том, дойдет ли оно до адресата? Ведь и в книгах, а в последствии и в фильмах были подобные послание, но одно дело услышать их, а совсем другое пойти и воплотить в жизнь. У меня нет ответа на этот вопрос, да и откуда ему взяться? Я не суперкомпьютер, который может сказать «42» и все ответы будут найдены сами собой. Я такой же человек как и вы. И как человек человеку я посоветую сыграть в эту игру. Полтора часа это не так уж много, да и как знать, может и впрямь сможете вынести из нее нечто большее чем историю о двух четырнадцатилетних девочках, которые любили друг друга больше жизни?

23190601.review:
"The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns" is what you expect. A tearjerking visual novel game that tells the story of a little girl. For a free game, this exceeded my expectations!

Graphics:
The drawings in this game were pretty unique! It was a combination of regular artwork with a little anime touch to them. It is bright, colorful, and cheery.

Story:
This is the story of Toma Andrews, who is a socially awkward girl. She feels her name has no meaning whatsoever and believes she is nothing. There is one weird thing that her and her mom have in common: they love to visit the graveyard and love talking about their ancestors. One day though, she skipped school and hung out at the graveyard again. This is where she comes across a peculiar girl named Emmeline Burns.

And...I stop there for spoiler purposes. All I can say about the story is OH MY GOD THE FEELS!!! I actually cried during the end of the game and for the characters of the story. The story is just...downright beautiful and tear-jerking.

Music:
I loved the piano pieces in this game. It fits perfectly with the story and the graphics. It was a combination of relaxing, bittersweet happiness, and sadness. I could get absorbed into this soundtrack.

Gameplay:
Visual Novel. You know the drill. Oh...it does have extras though! A music box, a gallery, and an extra scene when you complete the game!

Overall:
The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns pulls your heartstrings with tragedy, happiness, and bittersweetness. This is one of those games where everything comes together. The beautiful piano music, the bright and beautiful unique artwork, and the bittersweet tearjerking story.--Okay. Why is this game free to play? Seriously, if I known it would be this good, I'd fork over my money without waiting for a sale(yes I'm that cheap). Ahem...right. As I said before, this game exceeded my expectations. Normally, you see reviews "Eh...it's my money's worth." or "Another crappy free-to-play game." However, this is different. This is a visual novel gem that everyone should play through and proves, regardless of what happens, everything will turn out well in the end as long as you see it through.

22977651.review:
Masterpiece  ღ

! Don't read if you don't like spoilers !

It has been a really long time since I've read such a great visual novel. I'm usually not into free games since there isn't much work on them and they have really poor stories , drawing style etc but this one got my attention by just randomly seeing it. First i had doubts i mean the drawing looked so good , really girlish design but then i was wondering about the content in this game if it was satisfying enough. Well why not giving it a try? After i downloaded it and started it i already fell in love with the beautiful main menu ! Those soft girlish pastel colours , style of drawing...top top top! 

When the game started i was feeling like im reading a story about myself..a life story to be honest. The main Heroine in this game ( Toma ) is really in a lot of ways like me even tho its just a game..i couldn't believe how this is similar to me like i was talking to the creator of this game and he made a game out of me with a few changes . Since i had the similar thing as Toma with the name chosen by her mother which wasn't supposed to be Toma but Amelia, i remembered how my mother told me something long long time ago. 

It feels really creepy if you play a game and its like you can look into a mirror ..see yourself . The more i was reading, i could replace myself with Toma .. being different then others seems really annoying and you want to change yourself etc i guess its just us people in this world who can't be happy with what we are or what we have. I guess another reason why i got attached to this game is that im interested in History,Victorian history..just old things that not everyone cares to talk about or do researches and this game has this " old " style. I love how this game is made so realistic and it has a rich story which i didn't read for a long time as mentioned.

Well the game is not really long and you can finish it between 1-2 hours but i personally didn't feel like to just read fast and see what happens. The story made me feel like im experiencing it in real life and i wanted to understand or better to say " feel " the story. Since im a sensitive person, to be honest i cried a few times while reading .. wonderful music , art , in game atmosphere.
Maybe im hyping it to much but i think this game deserves to become a Movie. I would even pay money for the game because in my opinion it shouldn't be a free game its way better than just a free game actually .

After finishing it i got the strength to love myself the way i am even more and appreciate it . I learned that being the unique " yourself" is better than wanting being someone different and that every single person has their own story . We live for reasons and out of each single person there will be some day a different story..beautiful story, happy story , sad story  etc . This is a "game" with quality after all it teaches the person who is playing it something really valuable which you don't see in other games . Another thing which you can learn is that a game doesn't need to be famous or hyped to have quality.

At all i highly really highly recommend it ! For me its one of my favorite games till now . I think you really should try it out ! Don't read the story fast and try to focus on the speech of the characters im sure you will experience the game different then just fast clicking it away. 

Merci for reading
                    Stay true to yourself ღ

22759318.review:
[b]"We need to haunt the house of history and listen anew to the ancestors' wisdom."  - Maya Angelou[/b]

Remember that great aunt of yours that you are supposed to look exactly the same? Or the father of your grandfather, smiling the same peculiar way that you do according to your mother? Looking back beyond our own lives and limited lifespans, we cannot help but wonder about our own families - the roots that we came from. Men and women before us, and many others before them consist of the roots of a tree or veins in a whole body, connected to one another to serve a magnificent whole. Metaphors aside, we get to wonder about the notion of a bloodline. A bloodline - aside being a definitive biological function, serves as roots for people. Tracing them back to ages before, we get the fundamental feeling that a part of us has always been travelling in between times through our ancestors before us and will keep travelling after us through our own offspring. Considering the poetry of lineage, one does also wonder whether the same souls would be travelling in the same bloodline, waking into new lives in new generations...

[i]The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns[/i] is a story about ancestry and the third visual novel coming from Ebi-Hime, after [i]The Way we All Go[/i] and [i]Asphyxia[/i]. It is also the first of Ebi-Hime's games that I've come to play yet. Aside being a bit short, I must confess that it is incredibly well-done for a freeware, both with the narrative content and art work. As a side notice, this is a Yuri title, containing female/female romance with exceedingly beautiful and elegant depiction.

Our heroine is Toma Andrews, a young girl of age 15 living in Barrowby, England. Toma, growing up with her mother and her peculiar obsession about family history has come to develop a certain affinity for graveyards. Considering her shy and introverted personality, this wouldn't be the weirdest thing about Toma though. She is a sensitive young girl with a vast inner world - always an outsider to most of her coevals. One day, she decides to skip the school and take a walk in the nearby cemetery, only to meet a strange young girl named Emily. Exchanging stories with her, Emily comes to tell her the sad story of Emmeline Burns - full of vibrant beauty and a shocking tragedy.

The art in the game comes from SillySelly - who also illustrated various other games for Ebi-Hime - and her style is incredibly beautiful with pastel colors, fleeting images and a rich environment. Characters look like as if they've been taken out of a Renaissance poem; with flowing hair, shiny eyes and blushing cheeks. This ideal beauty - Donna Angelicata - serves to be a striking contrast with the dark tone of the story. This kind of Petrarchan idealization in visuals coming together with the melancholic narrative creates a sense of eeriness, wrapping the setting in a Byronesque air with strong impulses and an impending darkness hidden behind the vibrant colors.

The narrative uses countless literary references - especially centering on English poetry and some nuances from Gothic literature. Descriptions are always elegant, yet point on with the intended feeling, engulfing you before you'd be aware of its effect. The Yuri part is more of an undertone rather than the aim, arranging a fittingly immaterial nature to the storyline and all its characters, depicted almost spiritual.

Overall, I loved [i]The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns[/i]. Even though short lived, it presented a beautiful impact and a lesson that anyone can benefit from in the end: life is fragile and very valuable. The notion especially becomes wondrously sacred and meaningful if it were to be thought as a whole, rather than a single life. A lineage is a being, and a whole with the rest, throughout history. As one of the most elegant and surprisingly Gothic declarations of "Memento Mori", I strongly recommend the game.

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

22443987.review:
Грустная история Эммилин Бёрнс - красивая и грустная визуальная новелла со светлой концовкой.

1) Сюжет: история повествует о встрече скромной девушки по имени Тома, полюбившей кладбища благодаря интересу её матери к прошлому и своей родословной, и призрака девушки по имени Эми. Большая часть сюжета это рассказ Эми своей грустной истории, о своей семье, о любви к своей подруге (игра жанра Юри, но хардкорных описаний жизни острова Лесбос здесь нет, любовь двух девушек подана аккуратно, тактично и невинно), и о том как она стала призраком. Концовка в игре добрая и обнадеживающая. История в меру грустная, но при этом очень светлая, подана хорошим языком. 

2) Геймплей: игрового процесса особо и нет, мы просто читаем текст, выборов нет, развилок тоже. Если вчитываться в текст, пройти всю игру, включая дополнительную сцену можно за час. Если есть желание побыстрому собрать все ачивки, то пролистав все, за 3-5 минут +1 идеальная игра у Вас в профиле.

3) Графика и звуки: в игре очень красивая рисовка - напоминающая добротные иллюстрации к девчачьим книгам про Викторианскую эпоху. Артов в целом немного, но все они сделаны очень качественно, как задники, так и персонажи. Музыка в игре легкая, мягкая, и очень приятная. Всего 5 композиций, не считая песни в титрах.

Как итог: замечательная, светлая и добрая визуальная новелла, про любовь двух девушек, и принятие себя. Любителям таких вещей, знающим английский (ибо перевода пока нет), рекомендую однозначно.
10 светлых историй из 10.

22265206.review:
The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is a romantic drama with a Yuri theme, now before blindly go getting it based just on Yuri (-_-) *sigh* please note it is not what you immediately think it is and it annoys me when that is generally the first thing that comes to peoples mind when the word Yuri is mentioned in connection with VN's, a quick read of the description will tell that it is far from that..... 

"Toma Andrews, aged 14, has always felt like an outsider. She enjoys spending time in graveyards, and feels more comfortable among the dead than the living. That is, until Toma meets a strange girl in her local graveyard who might be a real ghost. The girl asks Toma if she will stay for a while and listen to a story. A story about a girl called Emmeline Burns, who died a tragic death back in 1851. Toma is compelled to listen, but at the same time, she feels uneasy. After all, what can she do? How could she ever hope to help somebody who has already died?" - Description

So coming into this VN I didn't know what to expect, however I was pleasantly surprised to find what a great story it had, it was a very interesting read; and suffice to say I have reread this VN many times.

The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is based on historical Europe with a little dose of present day thrown in.

Length wise it is not the longest VN I have come across, but it doesn't need to be it tells its story well in the period of time needed, any longer and the feel would be completely off, as if to make it worse by drawing it out so though some will be disappointed at its short length it is for the best.

The art style I must say is incredible, its unlike what most VN's have and has a certain charm to it; and not just the characters the backgrounds are very good also, the game has a great use of colour to contrast between various scenes and locations.

The music is well done and adds to the atmosphere and complements the game quiet well, it is not often free VN's have such a well used sound track

Overall The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is beautifully written piece of work; It is visually appealing, the characters are interesting, Tomas journey of self-discovery is worth investing in, the Yuri content is pleasant and not extreme and fits well within the flow of the story.

I'll leave you with this, The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is a great read and will no doubt keep you interested throughout its duration, and its absolutely free if thats not a good reason to check it out I dont know what is....so why not give it a try.

(Like all my reviews I do not put a score as it is my belief that games like all forms of art are subjective and therefore it is impossible to afix a number to them)

J'avais mis ce visual novel en favori par intérêt pour ses graphismes, sans lire le résumé. Et je ne suis pas déçu. 

A propos du résumé: c'est l'histoire d'une jeune adolescente de 14 ans, Toma, très timide et assez renfermée sur elle-même. Ayant l'habitude d'effectuer des recherches généalogiques en parcourant les cimetières avec sa mère, elle décide un jour de sécher les cours et de se rendre dans l'un d'entre eux. C'est là qu'elle rencontre une jeune fille qui va lui apprendre une belle mais terrible histoire...

Graphiquement, le style est assez particulier, très "doux", les personnages ressemblent à des poupées, ça se prête très bien à l'ambiance du VN. La musique est agréable, douce, elle donne une atmosphère particulière.

Quand à l'histoire, c'est un kinetic avec du yuri/ romance/ tranche de vie. On devine assez facilement ce qu'il va se passer à certains moments, un peu plus de surprise aurait été bienvenu. Mais c'est du détail. 

/Spoil/ effectuant moi même des recherche généalogiques, j'ai beaucoup apprecié le côté philosophique de l'héroine sur ces questions. Il m'ait déjà arrivé d'avoir le même genre de songe.

22064688.review:
I don't think I have much to say about the game beyond what has already been said. Simply put, as a fan of Asphyxia, the moment I saw this pop up in my recommend list, I had to play it. And I certainly wasn't disappointed. 

I think the title of this game doesn't quite fit the content - it's so much more than a sad story. There are moments of joy and gaiety that were just as moving as the aforementioned sadness. For a free to play game that has a total run time of 72 minutes (at least for me), the creators succeed in creating a very emotional, very affecting piece of art that I'm sure will stay with me for more than a while. It did more than tell a story, it made me stop and reflect (particularly in Toma's parts of the story). That's not something many games (or novels) can make me do, so I wanted to thank the developers for that. 

One slight negative point is the music: though all the tracks are lovely and well made, it can be a bit jarring when one transitions into another mid-scene, particularly when the first track was mid-flow. It doesn't detract too much from the game but it was noticeable enough to be worth noting.

21986052.review:
The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns ist eine Visual Novel von ebi-hime. Im großen und ganzen sind es zwei Liebesgeschichten und ein wenig Drama. Mehr möchte ich aus Spoilergründen nicht verraten, zumal die Geschichte recht kurz und auch einiges sehr vorhersehbar ist. Mir persönlich hat die Story, insbesondere der Part von Emmeline, dennoch sehr gut gefallen.
Das Spiel selbst ist in meinen Augen leider kein Spiel, da man keinerlei Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten hat. Dementsprechend gibt es auch keine verschiedenen Endings und es hat in meinen Augen auch keinen großen Wiederspielwert, es sei denn, man möchte sich die Geschichte noch einmal durchlesen. 
Die Grafik des Spieles hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Es gibt einige Hintergründe die alle recht ausführlich und detailreich gestaltet wurden und auch die Charaktere sind überaus gelungen. Zumal es mal etwas anderes ist, da der Zeichenstiel in Richtung realistisch / naturgetreu geht und  nicht ganz so sehr Comic/Anime-artig ist.
Der Sound hat mir auch sehr gut gefallen. Die Charaktere sind zwar leider nicht vertont aber die Klaviermusik die im Hintergrund dudelt passt immer sehr gut zur jeweiligen Situation und lässt Stimmung aufkommen. Allerdings klingt es zu großen Teilen doch sehr nach klassischer Musik was sicherlich nicht jedem gefällt.
Was ich noch kurz am Rande anmerken möchte ist, dass ich es sehr Schade finde, dass es keine Bildergallerie gibt.
Insgesamt eine gute Visual Novel die allerdings schon etwas spezieller ist und sicherlich nicht jedem gefällt. Da das Spiel umsonst ist kann man ihm aber ruhig mal eine Chance geben.

21581732.review:
TL;DR: Short kinetic (visual) novel about identity and romance between girls.

[i]The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns[/i] is a kinetic novel, meaning it is totally linear and has no choices. It begins with a girl named [i]Toma[/i], whose story is also a bit sad, as she's a girl struggling with her [strike]teens[/strike] identity. She takes the role of both narrator and protagonist.

She meets a coeval girl, Emily, who recites her story to her. While Emily is not exactly the protagonist, she's still given a major role in the novel, hardly surprising given the title of the novel. The plot involves romance (in that poetic sense) between girls.

I found the story not exactly tear-inducingly sad but rather melancholic or depressing instead. That said, it isn't a bad story and it ends with a happy or at least hopeful tone. Perspective alternates between Toma and Emily.

The visuals are gorgeous (I liked the detailed artstyle) and characters have many facial and bodily expressions, even if not everything described is shown visually. There is no voice acting. The background music consists of beautiful, yet melancholic piano tunes.

I read it in about 75 minutes. The overall quality is good, and I detected only a couple of typos. It's also free and has a bunch of achievements, got for reading the thing through. If you're not bothered by a romance between girls and you like reading, check this one out on a rainy day.

20694695.review:
[b]Playtime to 100%:[/b] About 1 hour
[b]Keywords:[/b] visual novel, shoujo-ai, free

This is a short, kinetic novel (no choices) about a girl named Toma who has an affinity for graveyards. In one of her usual haunts she encounters another girl who tells her the titular sad story of the young Emmeline Burns. It's a tragic and emotional tale, but don't worry, it's not all doom and gloom.

While the story is fairly straightforward, it's well written and engaging, and the characters are fleshed out well in the short playtime. The pastel-toned art work is gorgeous, the music is nice and atmospheric, and the whole game has a gothic tone to it that somehow blends perfectly with the sugary visuals. The only downside is some dodgy sound effects that only pop up briefly.

And the best part - it's free! So there's really no reason not to give it a shot.

[url=https://merumeruchan.wordpress.com/2016/01/17/review-the-sad-story-of-emmeline-burns/]Click here to read the full review[/url]

20556341.review:
"Oh no, its going to be another awful visual novel and every moment is going to be predictable!"

Sometimes, I take great pleasure in being completely wrong. 'The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns,' while not a game or even a branching story at all, while containing only a few characters, is a very well written story. And rather than flood the reader with a rather large pile of anatomically grotesque fanservice, Ebi-Hime floods the reader with a bit of tasteful art and a wealth of unexpected emotions.

The writing itself is intelligent, well-researched, and doesn't stumble all over the page like the drunken flailing one would expect from a modern novel. I have hopes that this work of art will one day become a romantic classic for future, more enlightened generations. In fact, it has inspired me to write more on the topic of love, myself.

20549787.review:
(Yet another game suggested by Pink Lily.  Thanks, Lily!)

So, achievements of a free game led me to another adventure into another free yuri visual novel.  This one has some parallels with [i]Written in the Sky[/i], so expect quite a few comments between the two.

The first few minutes of this visual, I found myself very bored, yet intrigued with the question of "Where is this going?".  Surely other reviews were over-confident glorification that you see on Steam.   Though as the story went on, I found myself wanting to know more about where the story was going and who Emmeline Burns was.

We begin our story with a  girl who complains about the name she was given at birth (as someone with a peculiar name, I can relate with this).   She claims her original name was stolen by her aunt before she was born and she inherited the surname of her father, who vanished before she was born.  That must bite.

She skips school one day and meets a mysterious girl in a graveyard  (Unlike Azure from [i]Written in the Sky[/i], she isn't a chronic truant and actually cares about where she came from.  Though Toma may seem a little boring, she's more believable in her logic and behavior).  Upon meeting this strange girl, she learns that the girl is a ghost after hearing [i]The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns[/i].  The tale of a lesbian who passed away long ago on the same night as her parents.  She tells a tale of her tender love for her best friend, while at the same time, [spoiler]her father's descent into madness through severe depression.  She later has her life snuffed out by her own loving father[/spoiler].   That said, I feel the true sorrow of the sad story comes from two parts:  [spoiler]Emmeline's premature death without saying goodbye to her love.  Emmeline's father's depression turning him into a monster who kills his own family before slitting his own throat due to sudden poverty...doesn't help that his mother always called him useless. [/spoiler]

After Emmeline's Sad Story is told, you get a very touching revelation that makes for a very feel-good moment.  A moment of love.  A moment of acceptance.  A moment of closure.   The credits roll and you're met with an epilogue (which is nice, but feels unneccesary).  The bonus side-story is also very cute.


PROS:
+ A very cute story involving lesbians (though the ending may be a tad cliche)
+ A pleasant musical score for the experience
+ Beautiful backgrounds
+ Nice character design (it took a while to grow on me)
+ Free
+ Achievements 

CONS:
- There are a few grammatical errors here and there
- Advanced vocabulary will have you pausing to look up some terms
- Beginning drags its feet and ending feels a tad cliche
- No nudity (Not important, though I know that's a main issue involving other users' interests including my own.  It's nice without it, though...but it's just a personal preference.   Again, not important.)
- Last kiss not shown.

The game is relatively short, but it all depends on your reading speed.   For me, it took 3.3 hours for the main story and 0.4 hours for the bonus side-story.  Total playtime on my end due to being a slow reader was approximatley 3.7 hours, though most may say it's 1-2.5 hours long.  Fair warning if you're considering playing it.


For the first part of the game, I felt bored...but as the story picked up, I felt it was a nice experience.   Didn't cry (as many say they did, though I can imagine where they may), but I did get wistful during the story at particular moments...kinda' the same, right?

8/10   (A cute story about forbidden romance, sadness, revelations, and acceptance)

¿Qué puedo decir?, el juego es bueno.

El estilo de dibujo es bueno, o por lo menos no es raro.
La historia es buena pero no algo que no se alla visto ya.

La banda sonora sí que me gustó, es tranquila y pega bastante bien con lo que pasa en pantalla, además que tiene la opción de escuchar la banda sonora por separado, lo cual en mi opinión es un punto a favor.

En cuanto al audio el problema reside en los efectos de sonido, pueden llegar a ser bruscos, fuertes y carentes de  sincronía con la música. Todo esto más las bruscas transiciones desconciertan a cualquiera.

Tampoco me gustó su duración, pero no me malentiendan, no creo que debería de durar más, sino que (según mi criterio) llegó a un final y lo alargó porque sí, cuando no había necesidad.
Me he visto en la situación de aplaudir para mis adentros y encontrarme con que había más cuando ya estaba satisfecho, como un bufet que no conoce fin (Pero repito, éste solo soy yo, quizá a ti te parezca más apropiado).

Sin embargo esto no quiere decir que la VN sea mala, al contrario, no sentí como si perdiera el tiempo jugandolo, e incluso quizá sea un poco más de lo que esperaba de una visual novel gratuita que en su descripción dice "is a free yuri (girls' love)", que me hizo pensar que sería fanservice por todos lados, con chicas lindas dando saltitos y gritando a la cámara... material para pajearse vaya.

Ahora si, ¿Lo recomiendo?

Pues la verdad es que no lo pasé mal, quizá a ratos pero la historia rápidamente me envolvía de nuevo y la banda sonora me relajaba aún más.

Además es gratis así que no pierdes nada con probarlo.

EDIT: No se como pude olvidar poner esto en el análisis pero de igual manera lo dejo aquí.

Como ya mencioné antes la VN no intenta ponerte cachondo ni nada por el estilo, sino que intenta mostrar una historia sobre un amor sincero y sin compromisos entre dos personas que, sin entender lo que es el amor se aman mutuamente.

Es una historia romántica más que otra cosa.

20500617.review:
The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns is a KINETIC NOVEL. Not to be confused with a visual novel, in which you make choices to decide where the story will go. It's a KINETIC NOVEL, essentially a story book in the form of a game which you can't make choices or choose your own adventure.

This is my first true KINETIC novel. And it was a free kinetic novel on Steam and the art was gorgeous, so i decided to give it a read. I didnt' learn it was a kinetic novel until after i started playing. Even going through the options menu there's a 'skip after choice' option, but there are no choices in this game to make to redirect the story.

For a kinetic novel, the story should be paramount. So let's get onto the bulk of the review:

There are sort of 2 stories in 1, but as the title suggests, what's mostly focused on is the Sad Story of Emmeline Burns. Her story is set in Victorian England with her best friend as they discover they have lesbian feelings toward one another and we see them have somewhat of a secret love affair over their shared summer.  There are a few mentions of each girl's family: Emmeline's father always having to prove himself to everyone in the world, Cornelia's strict mother who is very well meaning. We don't see them, but they are mentioned. This story is told to us by Emmeline herself to Toma, who is supposed to be the actual protagonist. How Toma met Emmeline is that she wandered to a graveyard in order to get away from the world and sulk a bit and Toma herself has a friend named Hattie, who is one of her only friends who she's growing lesbian feelings for as well...

That's the non-spoiler version... But you can probably guess what happens...

Honestly i thought this game was going to be a lot different than the title suggested. The title suggested this was going to be somewhat of a murder mystery revolved around a dead girl [spoiler]namely Emmeline Burns[/spoiler]. Instead you got a story within a story and apperently Toma was supposed to be the protagonist... There's no mystery. There's no suspence. You can pretty much figure out what's going to happen ahead of time...

So needless to say, story wise, I am dissapointed and left wanting more. There's a lot of lost potential here:
- Toma is set up as a really interesting protagonist. She doesn't like her name, she was raised by a single mom who has this bitchy sounding sister who stole the name she was originally going to give to Toma while she was pregnant, Toma's mother loves going to grave yards and she's OBSESSED with history and ancestry! There's this whole family drama that could be focused on, but it's surprisingly absent! It's all talked about in the intro, but we're not shown anything else related to this drama!

- Toma is an interesting character, but you honestly could've scrapped her from the game entirely! Her subplot is so minescule that it probably would've worked better as it's own game than lumped into this game that wants to focus on these 2 lesbian girls in the Victorian era! This applies to Hattie as well. She's supposed to be Toma's only friend, but she just appears toward the end after the story within the story is told... Like Toma, she could've been scrapped out of the game entirely. If you really want to use these characters, the game should've been a murder mystery with Hattie and Toma having the detective's perspective OR they should just have their own game...

-Emmeline and Cornelia could've been delved into more as characters. Why not show us their families? How they live in Victorian society! Emmeline brings up at one point that there was a boy who tried to hit on her but she denied him! That could've been interesting to see for ourselves! How could Emmeline and Cornelia handle being lesbians in such a conservative period? I would've loved to see that! The romance between them is sweet, but if you wanna go full drama, why not show us what they're like when their apart? Show us their lives apart from eachother, show us what has driven them to love eachother, show us more of their families who are important to them [spoiler] and to some of the 'plot'[/spoiler].

- The overall 'plot' is just sort of 'meh'... Toma is supposed to be our heroine, but the game so desperately wants to focus on Emmeline that i forget whether or not there is an actual plot...

As you can probably tell, i have a lot more complaints about the story than i do good points... But even though i do have these gripes at all this missing potential, there are some minor good things about the game:

1. THE ART IS GORGEOUS. It really sets the mood and it's like looking at a painting in a museum. It also contributes to the atmosphere and really puts you in this sort of 'quiet summer time of happiness' sort of feeling where you feel like you're in those (very few) environments. Even the 4 CGs they have are beautifully drawn. I only wish i could learn to draw like that!

2. The music is great and also contributes to the atmosphere of the game.

3. The achievements are easy to get. This is a kinetic novel, so to get all of the achievements, just keep left clicking, after you finish up the main story, go to the main menu, click on the powder puff thing on top of the drawer, get your extra scene and boom - PERFECT GAME FOR ALL OF THE ACHIEVEMENT HUNTERS OUT THERE!

4. IT'S FREE!

Final verdict:

I wish Steam would impliment a 'maybe' option for 'Do you recommend this game?". For the plot and story, it's ok, but there is so much missed potential that this game ended up being dissapointing to me despite the cuteness... But other than the story, the enviornment it puts you in and the story of Emmeline that's being told (even though i have complaints about it) is really nice and you can tell the writer wanted to focus on this little summer love affair story and put a lot of nice little touches in there to make Emmeline and Cornelia a believable loving couple despite their age...

Ultimately it is a FREE kinetic novel. So I'll recommend it because at least you're not paying anything for this short and sweet little story.

20464657.review:
I don't know how to feel about this visual novel (and visual novel it is- no gameplay, no choices to be had, etc).

On the one hand, it's free. The visuals and soundtrack are pleasant, much better than I was expecting. The writing was above average as well, which was another welcome surprise. And it's about women who love women, which I am always eager to see.

It's very short. I completed it entirely in less than an hour.

On the other hand. The story was... rather poorly done, imo. The framing with Toma wasn't necessary at all to tell the story of Emmeline, which itself was... trite?  Emmeline and Cornelia just seemed like typical yuri stereotypes rather than their own characters-- which is really weird considering they're the ones you see for most of the game. I wasn't moved by their tragedy whatsoever. It was oddly paced and made for poor connection with the characters.

On a nit-pickier note, I felt like they were perhaps a bit too verbose for 14 year olds. I get that it's the 1800's, but something about the way Emmeline and Cornelia spoke really didn't fit with the fact they were 14. For some reason I just don't feel like 14 year olds, even in the 1800's, spoke quite so poetically.

The sound effects are truly abysmal and ear-piercing. They completely ruin the soundtrack when they play.

This all being said, I realize this was made for a game jam, and perhaps the story would have been improved had there been more time sown into it. (Or even just certain aspects- less time on the buildup with Toma and more time on Emmeline's story.)

But... based on the great reviews, I was expecting something pretty noteworthy, something that would tug at my gay little heartstrings. What I got was just a mediocre and predictable story that I didn't feel focused as much on lesbian love as it advertises. 

If you're looking for something great that is saturated with LGBT goodness (like I was), I would say you might want to look elsewhere. If you're looking for a quick (and quickly done) yuri story, well... here it is. It's alright for a free one-shot, but frankly I was so disappointed with the story that I don't think I could recommend it.

20385685.review:
I found that The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns to be a pretty cute and emotional story. The story starts off following a confused girl named Toma. Who feels like her life was stolen from her due to events out of her reach. She goes to a graveyard one day and meets a unique girl. From there a story is told about one of the graves dating back to 1851. Telling the story about two young girls and their innocent love. 

The story gets a bit dark at one point, but thats what makes it even more emotional. The game is free. So, if you are love VN's you should certainly take a chance with this game. It'll only take a couple hours of your life. This game has a lovely soundtrack and art. The story is short and good. I loved the style of writing. 20383234.review:
Why is this so short? I mean stretching it any further would probably ruin the story but all the same I did not want this to end. 

Created by the same team behind Asphyxia, this short story is far lighter than the previous title and yet still just as powerful from an emotional perspective, maybe even more so. It keeps the same style, even including an extra scene that references the characters from Asphyxia, but utilises a smaller cast and location to tell a tightly-woven story that works beautifully. The first character we meet is Toma, a young girl who enjoys going around graveyards and learning about the stories of those buried there (something that I relate too, quite a bit). She meets an old-fashioned girl named Emily who tells her the story of Emmeline Burns, how she had a romantic relationship with her best friend Cornelia and how a problem with her father’s business led to her untimely death. I found myself drawn to these characters instantly, and actually felt more invested than I was in Asphyxia. Maybe it’s because it’s got a lighter tone (which is weird considering I’m naturally drawn to darker stories as a rule) or maybe I’m just a sucker for Yuri romances (which I am) but either way it shows the talent of the creator in their ability to construct a story. After all this is a charming tale with a tragic touch, as well as taking a surprising look at the theme of identity that I wasn’t initially expecting. It’s simple yet effective, enough to give The Sad Story of Emmeline Burns a permanent place in my heart. 

I do not have enough recommendations to give, check this out to experience beautiful art, lovely music and an utterly emotional tale that will tug at your heartstrings incessantly. And if you enjoyed Asphyxia then you'll enjoy seeing more of that teams' amazing talent on display.

And all of this for free. Ebi-Hime, why do you spoil me so?

20345804.review:
I expected this game to be much shorter, being a free game and all I suppose...

And I sat there for the full 3 hours it took me to read it for my YouTube Let's Play video...

Here's my own personal 2 minute trailer for my playthough of this game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YGCVAIvZx4E

I need to first off say that this isn't really a game at all.  There are no choices to make at all, no puzzles to solve, nothing to do but read and click your mouse to move to the next part of the dialogue or story.  

It is a beautiful story that is both uplifting and very sad, but mostly inspirational and this virtual novel has some nice art work as well.

It's a good enough story that I feel guilty for not paying some kind of price to have experienced it.  It's a well crafted story that attempts to show us the beauty of love, loving yourself regardless of who you are, and how important it is to never take a single day for granted.  

I enjoyed it very much, even if it did feel like it tried to push 'female on female' sexuality on the reader a little too heavy for my tastes and comfort level.  Regardless, it gets it's points across in shining fashion and I will not knock it for the path it used to get there.
